attributes.action: Cap APR Rates on Loans, so that the maximum APR is limited to 20 percent.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to: 'Prevent the extortion of citizens in hardship by loan shark companies which charge astronomical interest rates'

Some loan companies adverts on TV mention interest rates that are a staggering 2356 APR (yes you read that right).

Why does the government permit companies like this to operate ? 
Hasn't anything been learnt from the financial crisis ? 

It's unethical for the government to permit companies like this to operate and advertise on TV. The government needs to cap APR rates to sensible levels that are enforced by law. I would
suggest an maximum APR of 20%.

Please sign this petition to lobby the government to bring a halt to this extortion by unprincipled companies and to put a cap on permitted APR rates - if this practice continues more      unsuspecting people will wind up broke.

At an interest rate of 2356 APR, if for instance you borrowed £1000 and were unable to pay off the load during the course of a year, then by the end of the year you'd owe £23,560. That's
scandalous!
